page.title: 20LANGUAGE
page.content:
The children have school language and playground language. They still use many Scots words quite naturally. When they play {bools}(marbles) they get {clarty }(dirty). They get { {scunnered }(fed up) and they {greet } when they cry. If they are {peely - {wally}they are pale:{lug}is ear,{ {baffies}are slippers and {the bairn } is the youngest member in the family. {Di } is the colloquialism for grand- father. {The tatties }is the potato harvest where they spend many autumn Saturdays.
"CHEERIO FRAE A'BODY IN COLINSBURGH!"
